channel.title: Fright[Neutral Wildcard]
channel.description:
**Neutral Wildcard - Fright - Unique**
**Passive - Too Scary to be Busy** Occupation Immune.
**Day Ability - Fearful Trial - 1 use** Your name will be changed into Fright and no one will be able to talk except you that day,and there won't be a trial;since everyone is too frightened to vote.
**Night Ability - Frighten - 3 uses** Target player will be too frightened to talk at the other day.
**Night Ability - Cower in- 2 uses** Cower in target's room;being able to see target's room for the rest of the night. (Unseen=Unseen room,Cult=Cult Room,BD=Classes' rooms.) (Without people in it obv.)
**Objecive: Survive.**

item.title: Fright[Neutral Wildcard]
item.dc:creator: TryphonX
item.description:
Fright:

Day Ability - Fearful Trial - 1 use

Your name will be changed into Fright and no one will be able to talk except you that day,and there won’t be a trial;since everyone is too frightened to vote.

So basically when you use this ability you are revealed to everyone since your name would change, right? So the next day you’re executed by the Blue Dragon or Cold Steel’d by the Knight. Also stopping everyone from talking would make the game pretty boring and what is the point of you being able to talk, since no one else can?

Fright:

Night Ability - Frighten - 3 uses

Target player will be too frightened to talk at the other day.

Not bad.

Fright:

Night Ability - Cower in- 2 uses

Cower in target’s room;being able to see target’s room for the rest of the night.

(Unseen=Unseen room,Cult=Cult Room,BD=Classes’ rooms.)

(Without people in it obv.)

Again, what’s the point of watching someone’s room? The only thing you could do is determine their faction or even class at some time but what’s the point for a Neutral Wildcard to investigate? Doesn’t really make sense.

I’m always a bit harsh with comments on classes hope they help you improve it!

Read full topic

item.title: Fright[Neutral Wildcard]
item.dc:creator: Ashe
item.description:
I could see it being a viable class, but what reason does the Blue Dragon have to side with you? Your abilities are somewhat self serving (but could aid evil factions, similar to fool), but comparatively, with the alchemist, the other neutral survive objective class, people don’t kill you because you can heal them, while still keeping you at arms length due to the alch’s emerald potion, meaning you are both useful and dangerous to any faction. However, with Fright, the moment the BD discovered you were fright it’d be over, so I feel like this would work better as an Unseen/Cult class.
